a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of students in top PISA mathematics score level, male vs. female, 2015
Percentage of 15-year-old male and female students scoring higher than 669 on the PISA mathematics scale (i.e. scoring at level 6). For
reference, the metric for the overall mathematics scale is based on a mean for OECD countries of 500 points and a standard deviation of 100
PISA: Female 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level (%). Level 6
PISA: Male 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level (%). Level 6
Data source: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA)
